intro: Norta juncea, commonly known as the common flax, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its erect, slender stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces blue or purple flowers in loose, branched clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Norta juncea is a member of the Linaceae family and is known for its fibrous stems, which have been historically used for fiber production. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in gardens and wildflower habitats.
